info.title: Lumos
info.description:
The Lumos API gives you the building blocks to administer and extend Lumos programmatically.
    Our REST API provides a management interface for the AppStore and a read interface
    for the Lumos Core.
    Go to https://developers.lumos.com to see our complete documentation.

post.description:
**Create a permission attached to an App in the AppStore.**


*Required fields:*
- app-identifier. The App should be identified either by app_id or app_class_id + app_instance_id.
- label

*Defaults:*
- request_config:
    - appstore_visibility: HIDDEN
    - allowed_groups:
        - type: ALL_GROUPS
        - groups: []
    - request_approval_config
        - manager_approval: NONE
        - request_approval_stages: []
    - request_fulfillment_config
        - manual_steps_needed: false
- All other fields will have null values by default.

patch.description:
**Update an AppStore permission.**


All fields present in the payload will override the permission's data.
Any missing fields will be disregarded.

    Non-updatable fields for now:
        request_config -> request_fulfillment_config -> provisioning_group

schema.description: Include inherited configurations from parent app.
schema.title: Include Inherited Configs

parameters.description: Include inherited configurations from parent app.

delete.description:
Delete a requestable permission by ID.

    Only permissions of type 'NATIVE' can be deleted.

post.description: Upload a newly discovered document (e.g. Order Form, Quote) to Lumos for review

unique_identifier.title: Unique Identifier
unique_identifier.description: A unique identifier for the contract being uploaded. This can be an ID from an external system like Coupa, an internal ID such as a PO number, or simply the name of the file.

files.title: Files
files.description: A list of publicly accessible URLs that direct to files related to a Vendor Agreement. For example, the Order Form, Quote, MSA, or Terms and Conditions.

vendor_name.title: Vendor Name
vendor_name.description: The name of the vendor associated with this document

start_date.title: Start Date
start_date.description: The start date of the attached contract

end_date.title: End Date
end_date.description: The end date of the attached contract

source_app_id.title: Source App ID
source_app_id.description: The ID of the app that sourced this document. For example, if you are using this API to create a custom Google Drive integration, you might include the ID for the Google Workspaceapp in Lumos. This determines which app's logo is displayed in Lumos.

total_cost.title: Total Cost
total_cost.description: The total cost of the contract. If this is a multi-year contract, this should include the cost for future years.

unique_identifier.title: Unique Identifier
unique_identifier.description: A unique identifier for the contract being uploaded. This can be an ID from an external system like Coupa, an internal ID such as a PO number, or simply the name of the file.

files.title: Files
files.description: A list of files related to a vendor agreement. For example, the Order Form, Quote, MSA, or Terms and Conditions.

vendor_name.title: Vendor Name
vendor_name.description: The name of the vendor associated with this document

start_date.title: Start Date
start_date.description: The start date of the attached contract

end_date.title: End Date
end_date.description: The end date of the attached contract

source_app_id.title: Source App ID
source_app_id.description: The ID of the app that sourced this document. For example, if you are using this API to create a custom Google Drive integration, you might include the ID for the Google Workspaceapp in Lumos. This determines which app's logo is displayed in Lumos.

last_activity.description: The datetime of last activity of the user.

last_login.title: Last Login
last_login.description: The datetime of last login of the user.

AccountLifecycleStatus.title: AccountLifecycleStatus
AccountLifecycleStatus.description:
NOTE: If you update this, also update UserDomainAppLifecycleStatus

DISCOVERED             - Account discovered through accountfinding. Could be noisy.

STAGED                 - An account that has been queued for provisioning, but is not
                         provisioned yet. Relevant for Apps where provisioning is async
                         (eg. Okta, OneLogin).

ACCESS_CREATED         - When an account has been provisioned but not accessed.

ACTIVE                 - A live, active, accessible account.

SUSPENDED              - The user can no longer access the account, the license may or may not
                         be removed. The account can be recovered.

DEPROVISIONED          - The user can no longer access the account, the license was removed,
                         and the account cannot be recovered.

ARCHIVED               - The user can no longer access the account, the license may or may not
                         be removed. The account can be recovered.

MANUALLY_REMOVED       - The user can no longer access the account, the license is presumably
                         removed, but all of this was done manually

ACCESS_REMOVED         - The user can no longer access the account, but a license may still
                         exist. This is the case when we remove access through Okta but not a
                         direct integration

NON_CORPORATE_ACCOUNT  - The account doesn't exist, or is a personal employee account.

WAITING_MANUAL_REMOVAL - Waiting manual removal, someone was requested to remove the user access
                         from the App, and we are waiting for an answer about it.

app_id.title: App Id
app_id.description: The ID of the app to upload accounts to.

account.description: Metadata that Lumos can use to match the activity record to a software account within Lumos.

event.description: Metadata about the event being uploaded.

timestamp.title: Timestamp
timestamp.description: The timestamp of this event, in ISO 8601 format.

source_app_id.title: Source App Id
source_app_id.description: UUID of the application in Lumos where this activity record was sourced (e.g. the ID of Okta within Lumos found by going to Apps > Find your app in the list > Click '...' > Copy Stable Identifier)

app.description: Metadata that Lumos can use to match the activity record to an application within Lumos.

external_id.title: External Id
external_id.description: The external app's user ID for the account.

email.title: Email
email.description: The email associated with the account

instance_identifier.title: Instance Identifier
instance_identifier.description: The ID of the app as it is identified in the source E.g. the ID that Okta uses to identify the app

type.description: The type of event being uploaded.

job.description: State of the job to post-process the records.

AirbasePurchaseRequestEvent.title: AirbasePurchaseRequestEvent
AirbasePurchaseRequestEvent.description:
Model of the input we'll get from Airbase's webhook call.
All events seem to follow this same base structure, it is just `data` that is different
for each. We are using `dict` here to be permissive to other webhook events (so we can warn if
the customer misconfigures for a different webhook), and we actually only use 2 fields from it.

type.description: The type of this allowed groups config, can be all groups or specific.

app_class_id.description: The non-unique ID of the service associated with this requestable permission. Depending on how it is sourced in Lumos, this may be the app's name, website, or other identifier.

instance_id.title: Instance Id
instance_id.description: The non-unique ID of the instance associated with this app. This will be the Okta app id if it’s an Okta app, or will be marked as custom_app_import if manually uploaded into Lumos.

user_friendly_label.title: User Friendly Label
user_friendly_label.description: The user-friendly label of this app.

allow_multiple_permission_selection.description: Determines whether users can request multiple permissions at once.This field will be removed in subsequent API versions.

groups_provisioning.description: If enabled, Approvers must choose a group to provision the user to for access requests.

time_based_access.title: Time Based Access
time_based_access.description: If enabled, users can request an app for a selected duration. After expiry, Lumos will automatically remove user's access.

allow_multiple_permission_selection.title: Allow Multiple Permission Selection
allow_multiple_permission_selection.description: Whether the app is configured to allow users to request multiple permissions in a single request

manual_steps_needed.title: Manual Steps Needed
manual_steps_needed.description: If enabled, Lumos will notify the App Admin after initial access is granted to perform additional manual steps. Note that if this option is enabled, this action must be confirmed by the App Admin in order to resolve the request.

custom_provisioning_instructions.title: Custom Provisioning Instructions
custom_provisioning_instructions.description: Only Available if manual steps is active. During the provisioning step, Lumos will send a custom message to app admins explaining how to provision a user to the app. Markdown for links and text formatting is supported.

provisioning_webhook.description: The provisioning webhook optionally associated with this app.

access_removal_inline_webhook.description: A deprovisioning webhook can be optionally associated with this app.

custom_provisioning_instructions.description: Only Available if manual steps is active. During the provisioning step, Lumos will send a custom message to app admins explaining how to provision a user to the app. Markdown for links and text formatting is supported.

access_removal_inline_webhook.description: A deprovisioning webhook can be optionally associated with this config.

custom_approval_message.title: Custom Approval Message
custom_approval_message.description: After the approval step, send a custom message to requesters. Markdown for links and text formatting is supported.

require_manager_approval.title: Require Manager Approval
require_manager_approval.description: When a user makes an access request, require that their manager approves the request before moving on to additional approvals.

require_additional_approval.title: Require Additional Approval
require_additional_approval.description: Only turn on when working with sensitive permissions to ensure a smooth employee experience.

allowed_groups.description: The allowed groups associated with this config.

request_validation_inline_webhook.description: A request validation webhook can be optionally associated with this app.

expiration_in_seconds.description: [Deprecated, use access_length] Once granted, how long the access should last. Omit for permanent access.

access_length.title: Access Length
access_length.description: Once granted, how long the access should last. Omit for permanent access. All possible values are '2 hours', '4 hours', '8 hours', '12 hours', '1 day', '2 days', '3 days', '7 days', '14 days', '30 days', '90 days', 'Unlimited', but the exact options depend on the settings of the app and permissions.

requestable_permission_ids.title: Requestable Permission Ids
requestable_permission_ids.description: The IDs of the requestable permissions the user is requesting access to. Omit this to just request access to the app.

type.description: The type of content being uploaded. The only supported type today is 'url'

value.title: Value
value.description: The data to upload. This should be a publicly accessible URL that resolves to a file

unique_identifier.title: Unique Identifier
unique_identifier.description: A value that can be used to uniquely identify this contract (e.g. PO number, file name, etc)

files.title: Files
files.description: A list of URLs that resolve to files that should be attached to the Found Document

vendor_name.title: Vendor Name
vendor_name.description: The name of the vendor that this document is for

start_date.title: Start Date
start_date.description: The start of the vendor agreement

end_date.title: End Date
end_date.description: The end of the vendor agreement

source_app_id.title: Source App Id
source_app_id.description: By passing the ID of an application within Lumos, it will appear as if this Found Document was sourced from that app

total_cost.description: The total cost of the contract. If this is a multi-year contract, this should include the cost for future years

line_items.title: Line Items
line_items.description: The line items on the contract

app_id.title: App Id
app_id.description: The ID of the app that sources this group.

integration_specific_id.title: Integration Specific Id
integration_specific_id.description: The ID of this group, specific to the integration.

source_app_id.title: Source App Id
source_app_id.description: The ID of the app that sources this group.

detail.title: Detail
detail.description: The detail of the validation error

id.title: Id
id.description: The ID of this inline webhook.

hook_type.description: The type of this inline webhook.

name.title: Name
name.description: The name of this inline webhook.

description.title: Description
description.description: The description of this inline webhook.

name.title: Name
name.description: The name of the line item as stored in Lumos

type.title: Type
type.description: The type of purchase that this line item refers to

quantity.title: Quantity
quantity.description: The number of units purchased for this line item

unit_cost.description: The unit cost of this line item

start_date.title: Start Date
start_date.description: The start of the line item

end_date.title: End Date
end_date.description: The end of the line item. Null for monthly line items.

name.title: Name
name.description: The name of the line item as stored in Lumos

type.title: Type
type.description: The type of purchase that this line item refers to

quantity.title: Quantity
quantity.description: The number of units purchased for this line item

unit_cost.description: The per-unit cost of the line item

per_month.description: The per unit cost associated with this line item, amortized to the cost per month

period.title: Period
period.description: The period which this cost covers. Available options are per_month or per_year

value.title: Value
value.description: The cost in terms of the specified currency (4 decimal places supported)

name.title: Name
name.description: The name of the line item as stored in Lumos

quantity.title: Quantity
quantity.description: The number of units purchased for this line item

unit_cost.description: The unit cost of this line item

unique_identifier.title: Unique Identifier
unique_identifier.description: A unique ID for the contract being uploaded. This can be an ID from an external system like Ironclad, an internal ID such as a PO number, or simply the name of the vendor + date of the contract.

vendor.description: Information about the vendor associated with this contract. Currently, we will only support a name field.

start_date.title: Start Date
start_date.description: The start date of the attached contract

end_date.title: End Date
end_date.description: The end date of the attached contract

opt_out_date.title: Opt Out Date
opt_out_date.description: The date by which a vendor must be notified before terminating the order

auto_renewal.title: Auto Renewal
auto_renewal.description: Whether or not the contract auto-renews

currency.title: Currency
currency.description: The currency in which the contract is being paid in ISO 4217 format

line_items.title: Line Items
line_items.description: The list of currently active line items for this Vendor Agreement. If there are no currently active line items, the most recent set of line items is returned.

custom_attributes.title: Custom Attributes
custom_attributes.description: Any additional attributes that you would like to save on the Order. The set of available options must be configured in advance in Lumos.

source_app_id.title: Source App Id
source_app_id.description: UUID of the application in Lumos where this order was sourced (e.g. the ID of Ironclad within Lumos)

unique_identifier.title: Unique Identifier
unique_identifier.description: The unique identifier of the permission.

request_approval_config_override.description: Indicates if approval flow is overridden.

manager_approval.description: Manager approval can be configured as necessary to continue

require_additional_approval.title: Require Additional Approval
require_additional_approval.description: Only turn on when working with sensitive permissions to ensure a smooth employee experience.

custom_approval_message.title: Custom Approval Message
custom_approval_message.description: After the approval step, send a custom message to requesters. Note that the permission level approval message will override the App level approval message if custom_approval_message_override is set. Markdown for links and text formatting is supported.
